articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets with Italian Delegation of Lawmakers
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets with Italian Delegation of Lawmakers
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of lawmakers from various political parties of Italy led by Antonio Razzi, secretary general of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate who is chairman of the Italia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					 The head of the delegation handed Kim Yong Nam a letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un, which reflects the best wishes of former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi and all the members of the Italia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group.
					
					 Noting that during their stay they had an opportunity to witness for themselves the appearance of the DPRK developing day by day under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, he expressed thanks for the cordial hospitality of the Korean people.

articles.title: North-targeted War Maneuvers Should Not Be Repeated Any Longer: CPRK
articles.content:
North-targeted War Maneuvers Should Not Be Repeated Any Longer: CPRK
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean authorities staged the provocative Ulji Freedom Guardian war maneuvers against the north for more than ten days since August 18, driving the situation on the Korean peninsula and the inter-Korean relations into the worst phase.
					 The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) in a statement issued on Friday said that UFG was the most dangerous nuclear war maneuvers for invading the north, to which the "tailored deterrence strategy" aimed to make a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK was applied for the first time.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The south Korean authorities talked about dialogue but, in actuality, more frantically staged nuclear war maneuvers against the DPRK, revealing themselves the fact that "dialogue", "confidence" and the like touted by them are nothing but a smokescreen to divert elsewhere the public attention and conceal their belligerent nature.
					
					 They talked about dialogue while staging the frantic war maneuvers against the DPRK in league with the U.S. imperialists. This was an unbearable mockery of the other party and unpardonable hypocrisy towards public opinions at home and abroad.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the military exercises staged by the puppet forces together with the U.S. are the basic factor of disturbing the peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and blocking any process for improving the north-south relations and north-south dialogue. 
					
					 The vicious cycle in which the north-south relations are driven into a catastrophe due to the war maneuvers kicked off by the puppet warmongers every year together with the U.S. should not be repeated any longer.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should properly clarify their stance of whether they stand for dialogue or confrontation, peace or war.

articles.title: Vice-Chairman of Olympic Committee Refers to Preparations for Asian Games
articles.content:
Vice-Chairman of Olympic Committee Refers to Preparations for Asian Games
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Son Kwang Ho, vice-chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee, referred to the preparations of the DPRK group of players for the 17th Asian Games, when interviewed by a reporter of the Central Broadcasting Committee of the DPRK on Thursday. 
					 The 17th Asian Games are slated to take place from September 19 to October 4 in Inchon of south Korea, he said, and went on:
					
					 Despite the bedeviled relations between the north and the south, we decided to send the group of players to the Asian Games for national reconciliation and unity, guided by the Olympic idea of peace and friendship and have stepped up its preparations in real earnest. 
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un personally guided matches for examining the men's and women's football of the National Sports Team which will take part in the 17th Asian Games.
					
					 Our players' participation in the 17th Asian Games offers an important occasion in improving the relations between the north and the south and removing distrust between them, he said, stressing the need for the sportspersons of the DPRK to positively contribute to promoting the reconciliation and unity between the fellow countrymen through the games. 
					
					 Son Kwang Ho said the DPRK would send the delegation of its Olympic Committee and 150 players, coaches, referees and other necessary persons. Its players will take part in 14 events such as men's and women's football, swimming (synchronized swimming and diving), judo, rowing, shooting, weightlifting, gymnastics, archery, boxing, wrestling, table tennis, canoeing, marathon and karate, Son noted, adding: 
					
					 We are taking an active part in the works being under way according to the rules and practice of the Asian Games in the Olympic spirit. The DPRK delegation took part in the drawing for the 17th Asian Games and the international sports scientific symposium held in Inchon recently. 
					
					 Referring to the issue of cheerleading squad, Son said:
					
					 We had decided to send a large cheerleading squad in order to cheer our players participating in the Asian Games, improve the inter-Korean relations and promote national reconciliation and unity. 
					
					 But the south side openly slandered the decision to send the cheerleading squad, asserting it is a "group for political operation in the south" and "for creating discord in the south". Not content with this, at the north-south working-level talks held in July the south side took issue with the scale of the cheerleading squad and the size of the flag of the DPRK and finally raised even the issue of expenses which the north side had never mentioned, bringing the talks to a rupture. 
					
					 As the south side is displeased with the dispatch of our cheerleading squad, we decided not to send it to the 17th Asian Games. 
					
					 The DPRK delegation notified those concerned of the Asian Games Organizing Committee and those concerned of the authorities of the south side of this decision when it was participating the drawing for the Asian Games and the international sports scientific symposium held in Inchon from Aug. 20.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara arrived here by air Friday.

articles.title: DPRK Players Return Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Return Home
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK players returned home on Friday after taking part in the Second Youth Olympic Games held in Nanjing, China.

articles.title: Art Performance Given for Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Contest
articles.content:
Art Performance Given for Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Contest
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- An art performance for welcoming the participants in the Pyongyang International Pro-Wrestling Contest was given at the East Pyongyang Grand Theater Friday.
					 Present there on invitation were Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan who is also chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association of Japan and co-chairman of the organizing committee of the contest, and his party and foreign players.
					
					 Among the audience were Jang Ung, chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee and co-chairman of the organizing committee of the contest, Pak Kun Gwang, chairman of the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang and foreign guests staying here.
					
					 The performance was given by artistes of the Mansudae Art Troupe. Put on the stage were female trio and chorus "Oh, My Motherland of Songun", male quartet "Voice of My Heart" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Contest Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Contest Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan who is also chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association of Japan and co-chairman of the organizing committee of the Pyongyang International Pro-Wrestling Contest, and his party and players of different countries Friday visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the immortal story about the old home in Mangyongdae where the President was born, they looked round the historic relics preserved at the old home.
					
					 They also toured various gymnasiums of the sports village in Chongchun Street.
					
					 They paid tribute to the mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il coming out to the venue of the inaugural ceremony of Chongchun Street and were briefed on the monument to their revolutionary activities.
					
					 They were deeply impressed to visit various gymnasiums in the sports village which were successfully rebuilt as a comprehensive center for sports and culture as required by the new century and are making a positive contribution to the development of the country's sports and the exchange of sports with various countries of the world.
					
					 Pro-wrestlers watched demonstrations of Judo and wrestling of young people of the DPRK engrossed in training with the resolution to glorify the dignity and honor of Juche Korea and had joint trainings with them at the Combat Sports Gymnasium.
					
					 They deepened the friendship while playing a tug of war and arm wrestle with young people of the DPRK. And they also exhibited their physical fitness by pulling a bus.
					
					 They also visited the Okryu Children's Hospital and the Munsu Water Park.

articles.title: Gift from Italian Delegation of Lawmakers
articles.content:
Gift from Italian Delegation of Lawmakers
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting delegation of lawmakers from various political parties of Italy.
					 The gift was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Friday by head of the delegation Antonio Razzi, secretary general of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate and chairman of the Italia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association and foreign guests and a home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan and overseas Koreans visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Friday.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Kumgang-san Opera Troupe of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the association of its supporters visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the formation of the opera troupe by the President.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statues and paid tribute to them in humble reverence.

articles.title: National Sports Contest of Workers Closes
articles.content:
National Sports Contest of Workers Closes
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- A national sports contest of workers closed with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street Friday.
					 The Capital City Construction Commission came first in team standing while North Phyongan Province and South Hamgyong Province placed second and third.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea  and players.
					
					 Citations and medals were awarded to successful organizations and players.

articles.title: 10th National Folk Sports Contest of Agricultural Workers Closes
articles.content:
10th National Folk Sports Contest of Agricultural Workers Closes
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The 10th National Folk Sports Contest of Agricultural Workers took place at the Moranbong Youth Park in Pyongyang from Aug. 26 to 29 to mark the 54th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The contest brought together more than 400 players of Korean wrestling, Taekwon-Do, seesawing and swing selected from every province.
					
					 The Korean wrestling drew the attention of the spectators.
					
					 The Namap Cooperative Farm in Yomju County took the first place in the Korean wrestling, the Chilgol Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District in Taekwon-Do and the Sinam Cooperative Farm in Ryongchon County in seesawing and swing.
					
					 North Phyongan Province came first in team standing while Pyongyang and South Hamgyong Province placed second and third.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place on Friday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and players.

articles.title: National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize Closes
articles.content:
National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize Closes
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The 40th national schoolchildren's sports contest for Jongilbong prize closed with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall.
					 The contest took place in Pyongyang, Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province and Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province. The contest was held divided into senior secondary, junior secondary and primary schools. They competed in 17 events including basketball, volleyball, table-tennis, Taekwon-Do and Ssirum (Korean wrestling).
					
					 Pyongyang came first in team standing.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned, officials of the youth league, teachers of specialized sports groups, players and schoolchildren in the city.

articles.title: Scientific Presentation in Nonferrous Metal Field Held
articles.content:
Scientific Presentation in Nonferrous Metal Field Held
 Munchon, August 29 (KCNA) -- A scientific and technological presentation in the field of nonferrous metal took place at the Munphyong Smeltery in Kangwon Province from August 27 to 29.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians and workers in the field of nonferrous metal.
					
					 The participants heard more than 80 papers presented by various units in the field of nonferrous metal.
					
					 They introduced successes and experience they gained in putting equipment and production processes at industrial establishments in nonferrous metal field on a CNC and modern basis.
					
					 The papers presented by the Liquefying Shop No. 1 of the Tanchon Smeltery, the Lead Smelting Shop of the Munphyong Smeltery, the Pure Metals Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, the Nonferrous Metal Designing Institute and other units were highly estimated for their great practical significance in building an economic power.

articles.title: Scientific Presentation in Field of Well-known Liquor Production Held
articles.content:
Scientific Presentation in Field of Well-known Liquor Production Held
 Munchon, August 29 (KCNA) -- A scientific and technological presentation in the field of well-known liquor production took place at the Munchon Foodstuff Factory, Kangwon Province on Aug. 28 and 29 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the  General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers and researchers of the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science under the State Academy of Sciences, Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry, the Pyongyang Foodstuff Complex, etc.
					
					 They introduced successes and experience gained in developing well-known liquor representing their local areas and units and its production.
					
					 Highly estimated at the presentation were papers presented by different units including the Munchon Foodstuff Factory, Fermentation Research Institute of the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science, Pyongyang Liquor Factory and the Paekunsan General Foodstuff Factory.

articles.title: Joint Performance "Song of Mt. Kumgang" Given
articles.content:
Performance of Opera "Song of Mt. Kumgang" Given
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- A performance of revolutionary opera "Song of Mt. Kumgang" was given by the Kumgang-san Opera Troupe and the Phibada Opera Troupe. It marked the 40th anniversary of the formation of the Kumgang-san Opera Troupe of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan which was formed by President Kim Il Sung.
					 The President formed the troupe with Korean artistes in Japan in Juche 63 (1974).
					
					 The troupe, general Juche-oriented art troupe of overseas Koreans, staged the opera before full houses in different parts of Japan and evoked a lively response among Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 The revolutionary opera was created amid the opera revolution in the 1970s under the tireless and energetic guidance of leader Kim Jong Il. It tells about the dramatic story in which the hero who was forced to part from his family during the period under the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists meet them under the bosom of the homeland again. 
					
					 The performance was given at the Pyongyang Grand Theater on Friday.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Ki Nam, Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam, officials concerned and creators and artistes of art organizations here, teachers and students in the art education field.
					
					 Also among the audience were Jo Il Min, chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, and its members, and overseas Koreans staying in the socialist homeland including members of the aid association of the opera troupe.

articles.title: Near Infrared Spectrum Analyzer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Near Infrared Spectrum Analyzer Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology in the DPRK developed near infrared spectrum analyzer with their own technology and efforts.
					 The analyzer measures the intensity of reflected rays after it irradiates a sample with monochromatic light of 1,000-2,500nm in wavelength. This computer-controlled device helps analyze the content of ingredients of various organic matters quickly and accurately.
					
					 It can be used in various economic fields including foodstuff, chemistry and livestock.
					
					 The analyzer won a high appreciation at the recent 13th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technologies.

articles.title: Ryongsan Revolutionary Museum in DPRK
articles.content:
Ryongsan Revolutionary Museum in DPRK
 Kaesong, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Ryongsan Revolutionary Museum is located at a site 20km away southwest from Kaesong City in the DPRK. 
					 The museum tells about the history of President Kim Il Sung's field guidance to the Ryongsan Co-op Farm in the Phungdok Plain.
					
					 On August 25, Juche 46 (1957), Kim Il Sung visited the farm to discuss the development of the farm as well as the improvement of its peasants' living conditions.
					
					 While having talks with its peasants in a yard, he acquainted himself in detail with their living conditions and the situation of the farm. He stressed the need to realize the diversification, irrigation and mechanization of agriculture. And he took a measure to build a drain barrage on the Lagoon Hwanggang in the area in order to prevent flooding by high tide of the West Sea and the Kumsong River in rainy season.
					
					 Preserved at the museum are a picture of the President talking with peasants at that time and a chair, sunshade and straw mat that were used during his conversation.
					
					 The museum was opened to visitors on April 13, 1981.

articles.title: Mongolian VIPs Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Mongolian VIPs Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- O. Mashbat, advisor to the minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party visited the Munsu Water Park.
					 The guests went round various places of the water park which was successfully built as a comprehensive leisure complex on the bank of the Taedong River thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people and future.
					
					 They also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Mirim Riding Club, etc.

articles.title: Regular Military Counter-action Is Measure for Self-defence: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Regular Military Counter-action Is Measure for Self-defence: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia are seriously threatened by  Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The General Staff of the Korean People's Army clarified its resolute stand that the armed forces of the DPRK would further intensify their military counteractions on a regular and annual basis to foil the enemies' reckless moves for aggression.
					
					 The DPRK's regular military counteractions are measures for legitimate self-defence to protect the sovereignty of the nation and peace of the country from the escalated nuclear war threats of the warmongers at home and abroad.
					
					 The DPRK has made consistent patient efforts to protect the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and improve the bedeviled relations between the north and the south. 
					
					 However, the U.S. and south Korean warlike forces challenged the DPRK's just demand and peace-loving efforts by staging the joint military drills. 
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to react to the warmongers' reckless military provocations with regular and merciless military counter-actions, now that national sovereignty and right to existence are gravely threatened by them. 
					
					 It is the revolutionary stand and spirit of the army and people of the DPRK to counter the enemies' daggers with long swords and their nuclear threat with stronger nuclear deterrence. 
					
					 We can never remain an onlooker to the criminal nuclear war campaign of outside forces and their stooges on the Korean peninsula and a definite end should be put to it. This is the steadfast stand of the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK's powerful military counteraction will be taken at an unpredictable higher stage.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Grave Nature of UFG
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Grave Nature of UFG
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson in a commentary on Friday lashes out at the adventurous Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises staged by the U.S. and south Korean warmongers despite protest and condemnation by all Koreans and the repeated warnings of the DPRK.
					 The paper says:
					
					 Due to UFG the sky, ground and seas of south Korea turned into drill grounds for aggression against the north, rendering the situation on the Korean peninsula so tense that a war may break out any moment and driving the inter-Korean relations into the worst phase.
					
					 However, the U.S. and south Korean war-like forces are persistently floating hackneyed sophism that UFG is "annual and defensive" in a bid to cover up the gravity of the prevailing situation.
					
					 This is an open criminal act of mocking and insulting the army and people of the DPRK and all Koreans.
					
					 UFG is a nuclear war drill against the DPRK from A to Z even though the U.S. and south Korea termed it "annual and defensive".
					
					 This clearly reveals the unchanged scenarios of the U.S. to stifle the DPRK by force of arms while staging nuclear war drills against it for an indefinite period, and of the south Korean puppet forces to do harm to the fellow countrymen, backed by the U.S.
					
					 However, the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are sadly mistaken.
					
					 As long as they stage nuclear war drills to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK will put their counter-actions for self-defence on an annual and regular basis and take stronger steps one after another. 
					
					 Preemptive strike is not a monopoly of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.

articles.title: S. Korean Writers Start Hunger Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Writers Start Hunger Strike
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Members of the south Korean writers' society held a press conference and launched a hunger strike at the Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul on Aug. 26 in demand of the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 They condemned the present chief executive for refusing to meet with the bereaved families of the victims of the ferry Sewol sinking accident although she told them to come to meet her any time.
					
					 They deplored the fact that the demands of the bereaved families are being ignored in instituting a special law on ferry Sewol because of the deceptive acts of the ruling and opposition parties.
					
					 They said that they could not repress indignation against the reckless acts of the conservative forces criticizing the bereaved families for demanding the probe into the disaster, talking about damages.
					
					 The present chief executive should take measures to prevent the recurrence of similar disasters and keep her promises made to the bereaved families, they held.
					
					 They also called for instituting a special law granting the right to investigate and indict those responsible for the tragedy.

articles.title: S. Koreans Stage Actions in Demand of Institution of Special Law
articles.content:
S. Koreans Stage Actions in Demand of Institution of Special Law
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean people from all walks of life are staging a series of actions in demand of the institution of a special law for the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 On Aug. 25, students of Seoul National University, Kyonghui National University, Ehwa Woman's University, etc., professors of the Council of Professors for Democracy and other citizens marched from Seoul National University and Kyonghui National University to the Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul, demanding the present chief executive make a decision for instituting a special law.
					
					 Then the demonstrators arrived at the place where bereaved families were staging a sit-in strike in the teeth of the obstructions by the police and handed a placard to the bereaved families in support of their action.
					
					 In the meantime, members of the south Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice also held a hunger prayer meeting at the Kwanghwamun plaza on the same day to demand the probe into the truth about the disaster as early as possible.
					
					 They demanded the regime institute a special law giving the right to investigate and indict those responsible for the tragedy in order to ensure a thorough probe into the truth about the disaster.

articles.title: Strike Staged in S. Korea in Protest against De-nationalization of Healthcare
articles.content:
Strike Staged in S. Korea in Protest against De-nationalization of Healthcare
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The trade union of the hospital of Seoul National University in south Korea entered an indefinite strike on August 27 in protest against the authorities' de-nationalization of healthcare, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 The organization accused the hospital side of taking the lead in the de-nationalization of healthcare through an establishment of a company for raking up profits against the backdrop of the policy of de-nationalizing healthcare pursued by the "government."

articles.title: IS Flayed for Watching Bereaved Family
articles.content:
IS Flayed for Watching Bereaved Family
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on Aug. 27 condemned the Intelligence Service (IS) for illegally keeping watch on a bereaved family of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The editorial referred to the disclosure of the fact that the IS has illegally kept watch on a bereaved family member who had staged a hunger strike for 40 consecutive days in demand of the institution of  a special law on the ferry disaster.
					
					 It disclosed that the IS gathered information about his private life at his hometown.
					
					 The editorial branded such watch on a civilian as an illegal act.
					
					 Deploring that the bereaved family member is subject to unbearable insult, far from receiving consolation and apology from the "government," the editorial noted people could not repress resentment at the IS mercilessly abusing the elementary human rights.
					
					 From the historical point of view, the IS left no stone unturned for the security of the regime but its ill practices are going beyond a tolerance limit and it is making no scruple of preventing a special law on the ferry disaster from being instituted.
					
					 The editorial called for the disbandment of the IS in order to prevent the recurrence of the Sewol tragedy.

articles.title: UFG Condemned by Organization of Koreans in China
articles.content:
UFG Condemned by Organization of Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Hailin City Branch of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on August 26.
					 The statement denounced the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers for describing UFG joint military exercises as "annual and defensive ones" and taking issue with the DPRK over its self-defensive steps. 
					
					 The U.S. applied the "tailored deterrence strategy" during UFG, another undisguised nuclear threat and blackmail against the DPRK, it noted.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces stop UFG for aggression against the DPRK at once.
					
					 All the Koreans under the Hailin City Branch of the General Association of Koreans in China together with the people in the homeland will turn out as one in the all-people resistance and the justifiable and patriotic sacred war for reunification to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the nation, it said.

articles.title: Letter from Participants in Asian Regional Seminar on Juche Idea
articles.content:
Letter from Participants in Asian Regional Seminar on Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un received a letter from the participants in the Asian Regional Seminar on the Juche Idea held in Nepal on August 23.
					 The Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and developed and enriched by leader Kim Jong Il and the experience and achievements gained by the Korean people in building the socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence and defending the sovereignty, dignity and peace of the country and nation by applying the Juche idea are indicating the  way of the independent development of the Asian people and greatly encouraging them, the letter said.
					
					 The participants in the seminar deeply recollected the fact that Kim Il Sung rendered unreserved material and moral assistance to the Asian people building a new independent society, making great contributions to the independent development of Asia, it noted.
					
					 Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism formulated by Kim Jong Un is indicating the most correct way of realizing the independence of the popular masses as it is the scientific revolutionary doctrine, it stressed.
					
					 To defend the just cause of the Korean people is entirely the struggle for independence, peace and prosperity in Asia, it said.
					
					 In order to cope with the anti-DPRK propaganda of the hostile forces, we will widely inform the world people of the reality of the DPRK and its proposals for the independent reunification of the country and the efforts of the Korean people to ensure peace and security on the Korean peninsula, the letter noted.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign media marked the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Byvor on August 22 carried an article titled "Songun brilliant commander and socialist Korea" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. It said:
					
					 Socialist Korea founded and led by the great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il is winning victories under the wise leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its might as an independent power the U.S. dares not provoke and an invincible fortress defending the peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. was dispirited and its followers were stupefied with the grit and pluck of Kim Jong Un who is reacting to hardline stand with the toughest measure, dealing a heavy blow to military threats.
					
					 He is leading the army and people of the DPRK to make great leaping forward in building a socialist economic power and high civilized nation.
					
					 The world praised this as a miracle in the true sense of the word and the great victory of his Songun leadership.
					
					 The Bangladeshi papers The Daily Folk and Blitz on August 16 carried articles titled "By dint of Songun" and "Day of Songun in DPRK".
					
					 They praised Kim Jong Il for turning the Korean People's Army into a matchless army and the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state and satellite manufacturer and launcher.
					
					 The State Radio and the Apsara TV and Radio of Cambodia introduced the sacred revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il who laid the eternal foundation for the prosperity of socialist Korea with his outstanding and tested Songun leadership.

articles.title: Day of Songun Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Songun Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Seminars, lectures, round-table talks, photo exhibitions and film shows took place in Uganda, Ethiopia and Indonesia on August 21 and 22 on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The secretary for political affairs of the Secretariat of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, the chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and other speakers said that leader Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership by visiting the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army (KPA) 54 years ago, an event of great significance. They praised him for training the KPA to be a matchless army.
					
					 A vice director of a hospital of Ethiopia noted that the eye-opening realty in which the DPRK is winning victory over the U.S. is proving the greatness and validity of the Songun politics.
					
					 The director of the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. of Indonesia said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a military power to which the whole world is looking up and put the dignity of the country and the nation on the highest level, holding high the banner of Songun. His feats will shine long for all ages, the director added.
					
					 The director of the Dwi Mitra Perkasa Company of Indonesia said:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as the main political mode under socialism and brought about a dramatic change in hewing out the destiny of the country and its people. The Songun politics of the DPRK is the most wonderful political mode to be followed by all countries aspiring after independence against imperialism, he added.
					
					 The director of the Unido Azidharma Industrial Company of Indonesia said that the Korean people would win a brilliant victory in building a thriving nation as they are led by HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on August 19 on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 Leader Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership by inspecting the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Through the Songun leadership he developed in depth the idea of the great President Kim Il Sung on attaching importance to arms and military affairs and formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism.
					
					 The Korean People's Army grew to be the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army under the care of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK has become a powerful fortress for accomplishing the cause of global independence and is dynamically advancing along the road chosen by itself under the complicated international political situation.
					
					 The DPRK could fully demonstrate its might as the satellite manufacturer and launcher and nuclear weapons state thanks to his Songun leadership.
					
					 By carrying forward the revolutionary cause of the President, he turned socialist Korea into a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 The respected Marshal Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the party, state and army and making sure that the DPRK wins victory in the confrontation with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The Korean people are celebrating with splendor August 25 as the day of victory and glory of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea with high national pride and self-esteem.

articles.title: UFG Assailed by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
UFG Assailed by Nigerian Organization
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism issued a statement on August 22 denouncing the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet warmongers for kicking off Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises for aggression.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The situation on the Korean peninsula is being driven into an extreme pitch of strain due to UFG kicked off by the U.S. and south Korean authorities.
					
					 UFG with huge forces and latest nuclear striking means involved is a dangerous fuse sparking off an all-out war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is escalating the tensions on the peninsula and extremely increasing the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers are describing UFG as "annual and defensive one" in order to conceal its aggressive nature and danger.
					
					 UFG is an unpardonable military provocation disturbing the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and a blatant challenge to the sincere efforts of the DPRK to improve the inter-Korean relations and defuse the tensions on the peninsula.
					
					 As long as the U.S. and south Korean authorities persist in their war maneuvers for aggression and nuclear blackmail, the self-defensive reaction of the DPRK to cope with them will be put on an annual and regular basis and taken on an unpredictable higher stage.
					
					 We extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country.

articles.title: Asian Regional Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Nepal
articles.content:
Asian Regional Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Nepal
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Asian Regional Seminar on the Juche Idea was held in Nepal on August 23.
					 Hanging on the wall of the venue of the seminar were the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos documenting the undying feats of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerless great persons of Mt. Paektu and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Present there were the director general, secretary general and directors of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea and other delegations of Juche idea study organizations of different countries, the Nepali minister of Women, Children and Social Welfare, the general secretary of the C.C., the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and other personages of Nepal.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador to Nepal and his embassy officials were invited.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made by the Nepali minister of Women, Children and Social Welfare, the general secretary of the C.C., the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and the head of the delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea.
					
					 The director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea in a keynote report said that if the Asian countries are to dynamically advance toward the road of independent development while adhering to the anti-imperialist stand, they should take the Juche idea as the steadfast guidelines. He went on:
					
					 The Juche idea is the guidelines powerfully propelling the independent development of countries and nations. This is clearly proven by the Korean revolution which has won victories under the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					 The great Comrade Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea, the guiding idea in the era of independence, won victory in the anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War against U.S. imperialism by relying on the people under the banner of the Juche idea and successfully advanced the anti-imperialist, anti-feudal democratic revolution and socialist revolution and construction.
					
					 By relying on the Songun revolutionary idea and Songun politics based on the principle of independence, the great Comrade Kim Jong Il resolutely shattered the ever-mounting moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK, firmly defended Korean-style socialism and provided a sure guarantee for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The floor was taken by the chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, chairman of the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche, chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, secretary general of the Pakistan Association for Self-Reliance Studies, secretary general of the Sri Lanka Society for Self-Reliance Studies and other personages of different countries.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam departe con delegacion de parlamentarios de Italia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam departe con delegacion de parlamentarios de Italia
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 29 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de parlamentarios de diferentes partidos de Italia presidida por Antonio Razzi, presidente del grupo de parlamentarios de amistad Italia-Corea y secretario general de la Comision para los Asuntos Exteriores del Senado de Italia.
					El la ocasion el jefe de la delegacion transmitio a Kim la carta hacia el Mariscal Kim Jong Un reflejando el saludo del ex premier italiano Silvio Berlusconi y de todos los miembros del grupo de parlamentarios de amistad Italia-Corea. 
					
					Durante mi estancia en la RPDC, pude observar con mis propios ojos el aspecto de la RPDC en desarrollo bajo la sabia orientacion de Su Excelencia el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, dijo y expreso agradecimiento a la bienvenida del pueblo coreano.

articles.title: No hay que repetir ejercicios belicos anti-RPDC, insiste CRPP
articles.content:
No hay que repetir ejercicios belicos anti-RPDC, insiste CRPP
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas llevaron a la peor fase la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas desarrollando durante mas de 10 dias a partir del dia 18 los provocativos ejercicios belicos conjuntos Ulji Freedom Guardian. 
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria publico el dia 29 una declaracion.
					
					La nota califica el presente simulacro de prueba de guerra nuclear mas aventurera en que fue aplicada por primera vez la "estrategia del disuasivo de forma de ajuste", cuya meta es asestar el ataque preventivo nuclear contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y prosigue:
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas hablan del dialogo, mientras se entregan a los ejercicios de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC. De esta manera, fueron revelados que el "dialogo" y la "confianza" de que hablan ellas no pasan de ser una cortina de humo para desviar la atencion de la opinion publica y ocultar la naturaleza belicosa de si mismas.
					
					Hablar del dialogo librando los fanaticos ejercicios belicos anti-RPDC en contubernio con los imperialistas norteamericanos resulta un insoportable insulto a la contraparte y un intolerable engano a la opinion publica interna y externa. 
					
					 La realidad evidencia mas claramente que la causa raigal que perturba la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana e impide la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y el dialogo Norte-Sur es precisamente el simulacro que se libra por los titeres surcoreanos junto con EE.UU.
					
					Los belicistas surcoreanos no deben repetir mas la circulacion viciosa de llevar a la ruptura las relaciones intercoreanas librando con EE.UU los ejercicios belicos. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben aclarar su posicion si quieren el dialogo o el enfrentamiento,  la paz o la guerra.

articles.title: Son Kwang Ho se refiere a preparativos para participacion en XVII Juegos Asiaticos
articles.content:
Son Kwang Ho se refiere a preparativos para participacion en XVII Juegos Asiaticos
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- En una entrevista fechada 28 con una reportera del Comite de Radio y Television de Corea, el vicepresidente del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Son Kwang Ho, se refirio a los preparativos para la participacion del grupo de deportistas de la RPDC en los XVII Juegos Asiaticos.
					A partir del 19 de septiembre hasta el 4 de octubre, tendran lugar en Inchon del Sur de Corea los XVII Juegos Asiaticos, dijo Son y continuo:
					
					Aunque son peores las relaciones intercoreanas,  decidimos enviar a esta cita el grupo de deportistas para la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion conforme al ideal de la olimpiada aspirante a la paz y la amistad y aceleramos activamente los preparativos para el respecto.
					
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio en personal las competencias de examen de futbol de ambos sexos de la seleccion nacional que tomara parte en los XVII Juegos Asiaticos, ocasion en la cual dijo que la participacion de nuestros jugadores sera un importante motivo para mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas y eliminar la desconfianza entre si.
					
					Y enseno que a traves del presente certamen nuestros deportistas deben hacer activo aporte a la reconciliacion y la unidad de los connacionales.
					
					Enviaremos a la presente cita deportiva a nuestra delegacion del Comite Olimpico, 150 deportistas, entrenadores, arbitrarios y otras personas de apoyo y participaremos en 14 disciplinas, entre otras futbol de ambos sexos, natacion (la sincronica y salto al agua), judo, bote, tiro, levantamiento de pesas, gimnasia de aparatos, tiro al arco, boxeo, lucha, tenis de mesa, canoa, maraton y karate.
					
					Participamos en las labores que se realizan segun la norma y las costumbres de los Juegos Asiaticos convenientes al ideal olimpico, dijo y recordo que tomo parte la delegacion de la RPDC en la ceremonia de sorteo de XVII Juegos Asiaticos y en el simposio internacional sobre deportes, efectuados  hace unos dias en Inchon.
					
					En cuanto al grupo de hinchas, Son dijo asi:
					
					Al principio, habiamos decidido enviar el grupo de hinchas de gran envergadura para hinchar a nuestros deportistas y lograr la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y la reconciliacion y unidad de la nacion.
					
					Pero, la parte surena censuro abiertamente el envio de nuestro grupo de hinchas calificandolo de "grupo de trabajo politico en el Sur de Corea" y hablando de la "creacion de conflicto Sur-Sur".
					
					Insatisfecho con esto, en las conversaciones de trabajo Norte-Sur, realizadas en julio pasado, cuestiono la envergadura de nuestro grupo de hinchas y el tamano de la bandera nacional y al final, puso sobre el tapete hasta el tema de costo para el grupo de hinchas, de que no hablamos. De esta manera, frustro las conversaciones.
					
					Dado que la parte surena no desea el envio de nuestro grupo de hinchas, preocupandose por algo, decidimos no enviarlo a los XVII Juegos Asiaticos.
					
					Al respecto, la delegacion de la RPDC que participo en la ceremonia de sorteo de XVII Juegos Asiaticos y el simposio internacional sobre deportes, efectuados en Inchon desde el 20 de agosto, aviso a los relacionados del comite organizador de los juegos y otros de las autoridades de la parte Sur.

articles.title: Conferencia conjunta de prensa sobre Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional
articles.content:
Conferencia conjunta de prensa sobre Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional 
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 28 en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang la conferencia conjunta de prensa sobre la Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional de Pyongyang. 
					En la ocasion participaron el director jefe de la Asociacion de Comunidad de Deportes y Paz de Japon, Kanji Inoki, y el presidente del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales, Jang Ung, quienes son copresidentes del comite organizador de la cita deportiva, y los jugadores de varios paises que tomaran parte en el presente torneo. 
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los reporteros de la rama de prensa e informacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, periodistas de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), los relacionados con la informacion de las embajadas de varios paises acreditados en Corea, los corresponsales extranjeros y los periodistas de varios paises que han venido a nuestro pais para cubrir la competencia. 
					
					Jang Ung menciono en su discurso que en la presente cita deportiva que se efectua bajo el ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad, tomaran parte los luchadores profesionales de fama mundial de Japon, Estados Unidos, Francia, Brasil y otros paises y agrego que ya fueron completados los preparativos del torneo. 
					
					Refirio que esta vez los luchadores profesionales demostraran sus fuerzas fisicas, realizaran los ejercicios conjuntos y la presentacion modelo junto con los judokas y luchadores coreanos y disfrutaran la funcion artistica de bienvenida.
					
					Kanji Inoki subrayo que su ideal es realizar la paz del mundo a traves del deporte y la cultura y ha venido esforzandose  por ese efecto.
					
					Expreso su conviccion de que la competencia contribuira a la realizacion de la paz del mundo y rindio al pueblo coreano caluroso saludo. 
					
					Acto seguido, los entrevistados respondieron a las preguntas de periodistas.
